Mental health support

Alzheimer's disease can cause rapid mood swings, with a person shifting from hostility and crying to aggression and paranoia. They may also lose interest in social activities and become withdrawn. To counteract this, providing new and engaging stimulation is crucial.

read more…

Mental health practice

Medications can offer temporary relief from Alzheimer's symptoms, but they cannot cure the disease. With no current cure, early diagnosis, preventative measures, and mental health support for both patients and caregivers become crucial.

read more…
